title: Outplaying Lee Sin by juking his Q and sidestepping his ward hop is really fun and rewarding
body:
And then he flashes into you for an unavoidable ult, followed up by another Q, for 100% of your health (possibly under your tower).

Very fun and rewarding game play.

replies.body: Lee Sin mains will still be like: "He's balanced, you just suck."
He literally just got nerfed. And he _was_ balanced, people just complained about his early game, which is pretty much all he has besides his ult.
There's nothing balanced about him when he's picked about 90% of the time compared to other junglers.

You people and your infatuation with balance. Of all the bajillion things that affect pick/win/loss/ban rate, you always pick the most untangible, unprovable one: "because he's inbalanced."

Why won't we just admit that we don't know the criteria for "perfectly balanced"? Give me an example of a perfectly balanced champion and compare him with Lee Sin, please. And good luck with that, because there is not a single champion who is universally agreed upon to be balanced.

What? Warwick? His HP regeneration is one of the best in the game and his late-game scaling is bullshit. He wins 1v1 against Lee Sin at level 3, no joke.
What? Master Yi? You can alpha-strike dodge anything, get free tanking with Meditation, and he wins 1v1 against Lee Sin at level 3, no joke.
What? Amumu? AP Amumu blows the fuck out of everyone and flash+R literally just wins you games. Also, he wins 1v1 against Lee Sin at level 3, no joke.
What? [insert jungler here]? His [insert skill here] does too much damage and he wins 1v1 against Lee Sin at level 3, no joke.

The forums is a considered a joke because Riot, still, after 6 fucking years, refuses to become or elect a final arbiter for gameplay balance. They just listen to whoever's loudest. No one's opinion is considered [expert].

there no longer is a forum for balance issues and the "gameplay" forum was renamed from gameplay and balance
Winning 15-20% of all games played (in the entire game btw) doesn't sound like a balanced champion to me.
He still had a sub 50% winrate, with one of the highest average games played (79 games). Playrate doesn't mean anything when the average Lee player has played so many games on him.

Play rate destroys that argument. The reason his win rate is sub 50% is because everyone and their bronze grandma wants to main the broken bs that is Lee. Just look at this play rate. 33%... That's 1/3 games you'll see lee sin. Does that not mean anything to you? Nothing? How depressing it must be to rely on one little statistic. If you want to see how broken everyone views him as, just wait until 10 bans goes live. We'll see a near 100% ban rate on lee. 
(Oh yeah, that other 16% win rate of every game played period, is legit. It's also quite significant when you think about it. 33% playrate coupled with 20% ban rate = 50% pick/ban. Every other game he'll either be banned or played.)

How does a high winrate translate directly to overpowered? He's played a lot, and has a 50% winrate... He also loses 16.5% of every game, does that mean nothing? Just because a champ is played a lot doesn't mean they're op, it just means they're fun to play and a lot of people put him into their champ pool for that reason.

Think about playrate and winrate being on a teeter-totter

If play rate goes up, win rate should go down, and vice-versa
If you look at low play rate champions, their winrate will be higher because its the dedicated mains playing, and high play rate champions will have a lot of unskilled players using them and so the winrate goes down.

The fact that lee has a massive playrate and still almost has 50% winrate is a huge red flag that he is OP right now.

I honestly think the easiest way to tune down Lee would to remove those 2 BS ministuns on his ult.

Riot LITERALLY said they want to keep him strong because he "adds a lot to competitive play"

In other words he brings in more money in the LCS.

In other words, Riot is playing massive favorites.

Except every Lee Sin jungle has an average of 79 games played on him. That doesn't sound like a lot of unskilled players are playing him, it sounds like lots of experienced players just have him in their champ pool. Even with this, his winrate isn't even over 50% _and_ he just got nerfed last night.

EVERY lee sin jungle has 79 games? No.

The AVERAGE games played for Lee Sin is 79. Which statistically absolutely proves a ton of newer players are playing him.

The largest percentage of players playing Lee Sin only have between 15-50 games, do you think that is enough games to fully grasp and utilize a champion's full potential? Of course not, and even these players have above 50% winrate

And btw, for how mechanically intensive Lee Sin is supposed to be, his winrate with new players should be abysmal, since they would have to learn a lot before they would be decent with him, but his winrate with players with no experience on him is just below 45%, that means with absolutely no clue on what youre doing on this SUPPOSEDLY high skill floor champion, youre only 5% more likely to lose.

Still no red flags?

And one more thing, 49.9% winrate, that is basically 50% so you lee sin fanboys need to quit waving that around acting like .1% is absolute proof he is a perfectly healthy champion.

I never said every Lee Sin has 79 games. Undoubtedly there are some noobs playing him, but the majority of Lee players have 20+ games with him at least (more if you count normal games). It actually starts at around 42% which is what is to be expected. I don't know about you, but for me, 15-50 games is plenty of time to adequately learn a champ with a type of learning curve like Lee's. He's really not that hard to be decent at, just learn how to ward hop and hit Qs. Are you trying to say that you should be a master of Lee Sin to be able to have a 50% winrate with him? I think 50% at 15-50 games is fine, because it means they're decent at the champion, and therefore don't deserve a 42% winrate.

Btw, I don't play Lee Sin, I just don't struggle against him because he's not broken. I would rather see him on the enemy team than Shaco, Vi, Hecarim, or Zac.

He isnt broken, just overtuned and annyoing and he is intentionally being kept strong by Riot.

And I never said u need to master him, but Lee is supposed to have a high skill floor and a massive skillcap, but players are almost hitting peak performance with lee in the 15 game range. 

The difference between 15 games and 150+ is only 7%

If you compare that to other high skillcap champions such as Azir where 15 games is 34% winrate or to zed who has 41% at 15 games, lee has a higher winrate than that with ZERO games played before.
Yeah, I'm hoping they severely cut his dmg to assert his role as a fighter, not an assassin tank hybrid

Holy hell where have you been!?
His ultimate has the single highest potential damage of any ability in the game. Fiddle can 100-0 your mid and adc at the same time if played well. Sure it isn't as simple as Annie, but Fiddle BLOWS people up.

A rather common fiddle play is to have a solo laner push their lane in as you hit level 6 with fiddle, and then you just ult them from over a jungle wall + fear them under their turret for an easy kill. You often don't even need to blow a summoner to pull this off.

Fiddle has always been an 100-0 champion. I don't understand why Lee fucking Sin a fucking fighter/juggernaut/diver/whatever had assassin mobility and burst in his kit INCLUDING FUCKING MISSING HP DAMAGE.
The base damage not the total damage. It didn't lose any of its AD scaling.
Well 150 damage nerf is still something

150 at rank 3, its only 50 at rank 1. In comparison Lee Sin's base AD at level 6 is 76AD, so we're talking about less than an autos (even if he has bought no AD) worth of damage nerf. 

It's not nothing but damn.
yeah...they just need to follow that up with a 25% dmg reduction to his q, like hes legit retarded right now, has 1 ad item, one shots basically anyone

The term 'falling off" is often a misnomer.
Falling off would imply despite building damage, he would be weaker than another damage based champion.  This is not necessarily true, he is very competitive in terms of damage to champions such as Talon or Katarina.

CHampions such as Pantheon fall off.
Lee Sin doesn't fall off in terms of damage, he is squishy just like any other all damage champ.

Pantheon's damage doesn't actually fall off that hard either. It's just that in both their cases they fall off because when everyone groups if they keep building damage they will just get peeled and blown up before they can do anything.
Just saying, but lots of people can flash you for an unavoidable ult, that follows into a kill.
